page.title: 15MARKETING FARM PRODUCE
page.content: Most of the crops grown on farms are sent away after they have been harvested, though some are kept for feeding the animals kept on the farm. The sugar beet is sent to the sugar beet factory at Cantley, though the tops are kept for animal fodder. The wheat and barley is sent away to the corn merchants at Norwich. The farmer is guaranteed a good price for his crops from the EEC. Peas are also grown on some farms and these are sent to Lowestoft and North Walsham for freezing. The milk from the cattle is collected by a lorry Belonging to the Milk Marketing Board. The pigs and catlle are sent to the slaughter house in Norwich.
